#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=A Book of Revelation
#Text=The Irvings came back to Echo Lodge for the summer , and Anne spent a happy three weeks there in July .
#Text=Miss Lavendar had not changed ; Charlotta the Fourth was a very grown-up young lady now , but still adored Anne sincerely .
#Text=“ When all ’s said and done , Miss Shirley , ma’am , I have n’t seen any one in Boston that ’s equal to you , ” she said frankly .
#Text=Paul was almost grown up , too .
#Text=He was sixteen , his chestnut curls had given place to close-cropped brown locks , and he was more interested in football than fairies .
#Text=But the bond between him and his old teacher still held .
#Text=Kindred spirits alone do not change with changing years .
#Text=It was a wet , bleak , cruel evening in July when Anne came back to Green Gables .
#Text=One of the fierce summer storms which sometimes sweep over the gulf was ravaging the sea .
#Text=As Anne came in the first raindrops dashed against the panes .
#Text=“ Was that Paul who brought you home ? ” asked Marilla .
#Text=“ Why did n’t you make him stay all night .
#Text=It ’s going to be a wild evening . ”
#Text=“ He ’ll reach Echo Lodge before the rain gets very heavy , I think .
#Text=Anyway , he wanted to go back tonight .
#Text=Well , I ’ve had a splendid visit , but I ’m glad to see you dear folks again .
#Text=‘ East , west , hame ’s best . ’ Davy , have you been growing again lately ? ”
#Text=“ I ’ve growed a whole inch since you left , ” said Davy proudly .
#Text=“ I ’m as tall as Milty Boulter now .
#Text=Ai n’t I glad .
#Text=He ’ll have to stop crowing about being bigger .
#Text=Say , Anne , did you know that Gilbert Blythe is dying ? ”
#Text=Anne stood quite silent and motionless , looking at Davy .
#Text=Her face had gone so white that Marilla thought she was going to faint .
#Text=“ Davy , hold your tongue , ” said Mrs. Rachel angrily .
#Text=“ Anne , do n’t look like that -- DON’T LOOK LIKE THAT ! We did n’t mean to tell you so suddenly . ”
#Text=“ Is -- it -- true ? ” asked Anne in a voice that was not hers .
#Text=“ Gilbert is very ill , ” said Mrs. Lynde gravely .
#Text=“ He took down with typhoid fever just after you left for Echo Lodge .
#Text=Did you never hear of it ? ”
#Text=“ No , ” said that unknown voice .
#Text=“ It was a very bad case from the start .
#Text=The doctor said he ’d been terribly run down .
#Text=They ’ve a trained nurse and everything ’s been done .
#Text=DON’T look like that , Anne .
#Text=While there ’s life there ’s hope . ”
#Text=“ Mr. Harrison was here this evening and he said they had no hope of him , ” reiterated Davy .
#Text=Marilla , looking old and worn and tired , got up and marched Davy grimly out of the kitchen .
#Text=“ Oh , DON’T look so , dear , ” said Mrs. Rachel , putting her kind old arms about the pallid girl .
#Text=“ I have n’t given up hope , indeed I have n’t .
#Text=He ’s got the Blythe constitution in his favor , that ’s what . ”
#Text=Anne gently put Mrs. Lynde ’s arms away from her , walked blindly across the kitchen , through the hall , up the stairs to her old room .
#Text=At its window she knelt down , staring out unseeingly .
#Text=It was very dark .
#Text=The rain was beating down over the shivering fields .
#Text=The Haunted Woods was full of the groans of mighty trees wrung in the tempest , and the air throbbed with the thunderous crash of billows on the distant shore .
#Text=And Gilbert was dying !
#Text=There is a book of Revelation in every one ’s life , as there is in the Bible .
#Text=Anne read hers that bitter night , as she kept her agonized vigil through the hours of storm and darkness .
#Text=She loved Gilbert -- had always loved him ! She knew that now .
#Text=She knew that she could no more cast him out of her life without agony than she could have cut off her right hand and cast it from her .
#Text=And the knowledge had come too late -- too late even for the bitter solace of being with him at the last .
#Text=If she had not been so blind -- so foolish -- she would have had the right to go to him now .
#Text=But he would never know that she loved him -- he would go away from this life thinking that she did not care .
#Text=Oh , the black years of emptiness stretching before her !
#Text=She could not live through them -- she could not !
#Text=She cowered down by her window and wished , for the first time in her gay young life , that she could die , too .
#Text=If Gilbert went away from her , without one word or sign or message , she could not live .
#Text=Nothing was of any value without him .
#Text=She belonged to him and he to her .
#Text=In her hour of supreme agony she had no doubt of that .
#Text=He did not love Christine Stuart -- never had loved Christine Stuart .
#Text=Oh , what a fool she had been not to realize what the bond was that had held her to Gilbert -- to think that the flattered fancy she had felt for Roy Gardner had been love .
#Text=And now she must pay for her folly as for a crime .
#Text=Mrs. Lynde and Marilla crept to her door before they went to bed , shook their heads doubtfully at each other over the silence , and went away .
#Text=The storm raged all night , but when the dawn came it was spent .
#Text=Anne saw a fairy fringe of light on the skirts of darkness .
#Text=Soon the eastern hilltops had a fire-shot ruby rim .
#Text=The clouds rolled themselves away into great , soft , white masses on the horizon ; the sky gleamed blue and silvery .
#Text=A hush fell over the world .
